page.title: 04QUEEN VICTORIA SCHOOL(ADMIN)
page.content: The Commandant, an ex-army Brigadier is in charge of the administration, asssisted by a secretary.Below him is the administration officer (ex-army) who looks after the day to day running of the school. He has an office staff of three, plus the School Sergeant Major who also is incharge of the boys drill for Grand Day and monthly Parade Servises. About fourteen others assist with stores, maintainance, house and hospital matrons. Catering, cleaning, laundry and sewing are all now done by outside firms. The school is run by a headmaster with a secretary and twenty one full time teachers plus one part-time. There are also three instructors who teach dancing, piping and drumming.
